meanings.definition: The young of the domestic cow or other bovine animal.
meanings.sent1: The calf followed its mother around the field.
meanings.sent2: The farmer fed the calf a bottle of milk.
meanings.sent3: The calf playfully jumped in the meadow.
meanings.sent4: The calf's innocence reminded her of carefree days.
meanings.sent5: The little calf's soft fur was a delight to touch.

meanings.definition: The fleshy part at the back of a person's leg below the knee.
meanings.sent1: She felt a cramp in her calf after running.
meanings.sent2: He stretched his calf muscles before the race.
meanings.sent3: The calf muscle can be sore after exercise.
meanings.sent4: Her calf muscle felt tight from the workout.
meanings.sent5: Massaging the calf can help relieve tension.

meanings.definition: A large floating piece of ice detached from a glacier.
meanings.sent1: The calf drifted away from the glacier.
meanings.sent2: The ship carefully navigated around the calf.
meanings.sent3: The calf broke off with a loud crack.
meanings.sent4: The calf slowly melted under the warm sun.
meanings.sent5: The crew observed the calf from a safe distance.
